Defendant associated with a white Malibu sedan and charged with transporting undocumented aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle: White Malibu sedan associated with RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR., stopped by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino near Farm-to-Market Road 2050, transporting undocumented aliens, and suspected of being part of a smuggling operation with IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s black Dodge pickup truck
Defendant associated with a black Dodge pickup truck and involved in a traffic stop on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, transported to the United States Border Patrol station for questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle: Black Dodge pickup truck involved in a traffic stop on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, driven by IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., and suspected of being part of a smuggling operation with RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s white Malibu sedan, impounded by Officer Reymundo Reyes due to lack of proof of insurance
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.undocumented aliens: individuals being transported in vehicles stopped by United States Border Patrol agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle and IGN: Vehicles involved in the incident, including a white Malibu sedan and a black Dodge pickup truck, stopped near the Border Patrol Station Parking Lot, attempting to avoid the Hebbronville Checkpoint, within fifty miles of the Mexico border, with out-of-town registrations, traveling in tandem on Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol Agent with experience and knowledge of local traffic patterns, testifying about vehicle characteristics and road conditions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: Law enforcement agency involved in the incident
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Reymundo Reyes: Freer Police Department officer who conducted a traffic stop on IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle and observed his extreme nervousness, also testified about impounding vehicles due to lack of proof of insurance or other registration issues. Officer has impounded between eight to ten vehicles since the beginning of the year for various reasons including no driver's license, no insurance, or expired registration.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marco Montemayor: Special Agent for the United States Department of Homeland Security, conducted an interview with IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and ensured he understood his Miranda rights
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Department of Homeland Sec: Law enforcement agency involved in the incident, with agents providing testimony and expertise
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle stop: Traffic stop of RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s white Malibu sedan by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino on Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle stop: Traffic stop of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s black Dodge pickup truck on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 for failing to use a turn signal, where IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. exhibited extreme nervousness and gave consent for a search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle stop an: Traffic stops of RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s white Malibu sedan and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s black Dodge pickup truck on Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRI: Defendants with motions to suppress recommended for denial by the United States Magistrate Judge
